title: [K-12] Short-Intensive Course on Hierarchical Task Network-Based CSCL Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer application skills and understanding of fundamental science curriculum concepts
context.additional_context: Education on automated CSCL scenario design using HTN planning systems

learning_goals: Learners can explain a Unit of Learning (UoL) design framework reflecting student roles, learning styles, and domain knowledge in a Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL) environment.
Learners can construct a collaborative task network aligned with learning objectives using Hierarchical Task Network (HTN) planning techniques with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can prototype CSCL scenarios for small groups using digital tools and conduct peer evaluations.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (MIRO, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
